title: Bindi Irwin struck by more tragedy before wedding after sad death of beloved family pet
text:

Bindi Irwin has announced the sad death of her chicken Piggy, who made it to age 13 before dying yesterday.

The chicken was a cherished family member, and earlier this year Bindi posted a photo of Piggy, calling her a "lovebug" with "the kindest heart in the world".

The 21-year-old posted a photo of her cradling Piggy earlier today, announcing her sad death.

The average age of a chicken is 7-8 years, so Piggy beat the odds with her long life.

(Image: Instagram)

"For nearly 13 years you made us smile through life’s ups and downs", Bindi wrote.

"Rest In Peace my lovely girl."

Piggy's impressive age made her one of few pets belonging to the family who were around when Bindi's dad Steve Irwin was around.

The crocodile wrestler died in 2007 after being pierced in the heart by a stingray.

(Image: PA)

Bindi is soon marrying her childhood sweetheart, Chandler Powell, who she dated for six years.

American wakeboarder Chandler proposed on Bindi's birthday back in the same location he met her earlier this year.

Bindi has spoken to US Weekly about her hopes to honour Steve on the big day.

(Image: Instagram)

She said: "I really wanted Dad to be a big part of the day, so I’m excited to be able to incorporate him throughout the ceremony and the reception, and I think it’s going to be really special because I feel like his spirit lives on in us.

"It’s going to be a celebration of family and friends, our wildlife, and I think that night, it’ll be about our lives together and the joining of families. It’s going to be beautiful."

(Image: Instagram)

Speaking to the Sunshine Coast Daily, she said: “I do really wish that dad was here to be able to celebrate with us as a family.

“I think in some ways he is and his spirit lives on in everything that we do, and I always feel closest to dad here at Australia Zoo.”

As part of her wedding plans, Bindi hopes to have brother Robert, 15, walk her down the aisle in place of her dad, and her mum Terri is expected to step in for Steve for the traditional father-daughter dance.
description: Bindi Irwin is mourning the loss of her beloved chicken who lived to an impressive 13 years of age and was around when her father Steve Irwin was alive
